name: Thinking Machines Lab
title: Ex-OpenAI CTO's Efficient AI Startup

classification.classificationRationale: Validated Model 1 (Research Lab) with secondary Model 5 (Product/Venture Lab). Like Recursion, the company IS the lab — Mira Murati's startup focuses on efficient, customizable AI models. Primary classification as Research Lab reflects the focus on fundamental model efficiency research. Secondary Model 5 reflects Tinker product (fine-tuning tool) that commercializes research. Structural: research and product development in separate functions within the startup.

description:
Founded by former OpenAI CTO Mira Murati after her departure in September 2025, Thinking Machines Lab focuses on making AI models more efficient and customizable — positioning as an alternative to the 'scale is all you need' approach. The startup raised a $2B seed round at $12B valuation within its first 5 months, one of the largest seed rounds in Silicon Valley history.

The company launched Tinker, a tool that simplifies fine-tuning open models using techniques like LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation). This product commercializes the research thesis that smaller, customized models can outperform larger general-purpose ones for specific applications.

The team includes other former OpenAI researchers, reflecting the AI talent diaspora pattern where researchers leave large labs to pursue alternative approaches. The efficiency-first thesis directly challenges the scaling paradigm that dominated Murati's former employer.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: Founder-led startup. Team includes former OpenAI researchers.
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Founder-led; research direction set by ex-OpenAI leadership
observableMarkers.metrics: $2B seed round. $12B valuation. 5 months from founding to mega-round. Tinker product launched.

layers.label: Curation Review
layers.summary: Validated Model 1 with added secondary Model 5. Removed weakly-evidenced Mechanism #5 and spurious 'efficient AI' quote fragment. Fixed orgSize to Startup. Added habitat and classification rationale.

layers.label: Initial Documentation
layers.summary: Founded by ex-OpenAI CTO Mira Murati. Focuses on efficient, customizable AI models. $2B seed round at $12B valuation.

openQuestions: How does Thinking Machines Lab's efficient AI thesis compare commercially to scale-first approaches?
What is the organizational structure between research and product (Tinker) teams?
How many employees does the startup currently have?
taxonomyFeedback: Like Recursion, this is an AI-native company where the 'lab' IS the company. The taxonomy's assumption that labs exist within larger organizations doesn't capture this startup pattern.
The AI talent diaspora (OpenAI → independent labs) is a structural phenomenon worth tracking — it creates new specimens through organizational fission.
